steps: Stop all transfer operations immediately, shut valves.
Attempt to drain the overflowing tank to other tanks.
Initiate anti-pollution measures as per the SOPEP / SMPEP or other local Response Plans.
Inform nearest Authority (and other vessels in the vicinity only if pollution in water).
If liquid is entering the water inform the E/R about the danger of liquid entering the cooling water  intakes.
If evaporating vapour is present on deck, ensure all crew on deck are wearing full PPE.
All accommodation access doors should be shut and all ventilation with the exception of closed-circuit  systems to be shut down.
Smoking and naked lights should be prohibited everywhere on the ship and electrical switches  operated as little as possible.
If toxic liquid is present on deck and a presenting a toxic hazard to the crew, consider operating the  deck water spray to neutralize it. If in port, ensure local authority informed first.
If STS operations using chain linked fenders, consider using a foam blanket on any flammable liquid  in the water.
Check that liquid has drained completely from any low-level piping such as IG horizontal lines.
Continuously notify all parties of vessel’s actions / planned actions.
Switch off Wi-Fi and crew internet. Comply with Company’s Social Media Policy.
Conduct Alcohol Test for all crew on duty at the time of incident and record data.
Collect urine samples of all crew on duty at the time of incident for Drug Test (if incident actual  Severity Level 3 and above), sample to offload for shore lab test.

dialogueLists.dialogue:
The tanks are overflowing!
We need to handle it before it gets out of hand!
Do the SOP for it in order to prevent it from getting worse captain!

stepDataLists.callResponse: Deploy containment booms and skimmers to gather any oil that has been spilt, as well as chemical dispersants to break up the oil and absorbent materials to absorb it.
